intro: Eria unifolia, commonly known as the single-leaved eria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, delicate flowers that often bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
